title: Second man dies as result of drive-by shooting on Detroit's west side
content:
DETROIT, MI - A second person, a 43-year-old man, has died as a result of a Friday afternoon drive-by shooting on the city's west side, a Detroit police officer said.
A 64-year-old man also was killed in the shooting, which injured two others, ages 43 and 63.
As of about 10 p.m. Friday, no arrests had been made, according to Officer Jennifer Moreno.
The four victims were outside a house about 3:30 p.m. March 11 in the 2600 block of Hazelwood Street, near Linwood Street, when shots were fired from a possibly black Dodge Journey SUV, Moreno reported. Three men were in the passing vehicle, traveling in a residential area in broad daylight on a warm, sunny day.
A motive was unknown.
Anyone with information is encouraged to call the homicide unit at 313-596-2260 or 1-800-SPEAK-UP.
